text: You can specify which properties you want the  API to return in your query parameters

example
```params ={'hapikey': HUB_SPOT_API_KEY, "properties":"HubSpot_owner_id,name", "associations":"invoice"}```

Hi, got a quick question about the `API Key permissions`:
Is there a way  to check the permissions scope for a API Key using some kind of endpoint?
Where the response is `Your API Key has the permissions to fetch: contacts, deals, etc`

Agree <@U02AK2MA29Z> :clap:

Additionally, you will receive only those properties in response having values in a Contact. The API wouldn't provide you the properties in response having no value in HubSpot, even if you add in the requested URL.

<@U01PJMZ5KPH> I see that you're an integration developer at HubSpot, would you happen to have experience with the accounting extension API ?
I thought so since it's also an integration and I have a couple of questions that I haven't been able to find an answer to for a while.
Thanks !

Hi,

Well...as I know they have mentioned that HubSpot API Key always comes with full access of a HubSpot account to perform API related operations.

So, you can prepare an stack of required scopes manually at your end to utilise them :-)
Yes, sure <@U02AK2MA29Z>....would be glad to have a discussion with you. Feel free to connect me in person. Thanks
Thank you for your answer. That’s all
Glad to help...thanks :-)
you're doing `format(id)`  whereas id not defined anywhere.

Also, do you have specific associated old_ids to each new_id ?
Because the way you're going it now.
You have a bunch of main_ids, and for each main_id, you're merging ALL the same old_ids with that main_id

I'm not sure I understand.
you subscribed for an event ( say contact creation ), and you have your server running locally, and when you create a contact, do you receive that webhook call locally ?
Hi I'm Lucas Brum, I'm new in HubSpot and new in Backend programming, and I need know, how i get all e-mail id numbers with python in api?
What do you mean exactly by an "email id number" ?
You can try an email value like <mailto:yourname@gmail.com|yourname@gmail.com> as an ID. HubSpot sets the email value as an ID in a few cases. Would you please try to provide an API URL?

Hi folks, I'm Julie from GiveDirectly. We're trying to get our transactional single send api emails set up in python but having some trouble with error handling. The response for the *`/marketing/v3/transactional/single-email/send`* endpoint is <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/marketing/transactional-emails|documented> to contain a `sendResult` key, but I get a key error when I try to access it on the `response.json()` I get from posting to that endpoint. Anyone have thoughts on why it's missing? Looks like I'm just getting the keys `statusId`, `status`  and `requestedAt` but many more keys are documented.

Hey Julie,

As I can see, there are only 3 params in response statusId, status, and requestedAt

Most of the keys are documented in the API request parameter.

"each email have a your mail ID, i can use mail id in this link :
 <https://app.HubSpot.com/email/9319931/details/_*52683006347*_/performance>

and make a request.



i'm need all this mails id, for makes differentes requests"
`single_email = requests.get('<https://api.hubapi.com/marketing-emails/v1/emails/with-statistics/{}?hapikey={}&limit=1'.format(EMAIL_ID>, API_KEY))`
`email = requests.get("<https://api.hubapi.com/marketing-emails/v1/emails/{}?hapikey={}>".format(EMAIL_ID, API_KEY))`

Like this documentation:
<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/cms_email/get-the-details-for-a-marketing-email?_ga=2.49040290.520374241.1629131682-659401040.1629131682>
I need this for compare Mails information separated for each email

You have to retrieve the HubSpot-generated IDs via this API. The API contains many options to filter details.

<https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/cms_email/get-all-marketing-emails>

Receiving the IDs from this API, you can utilize them in your call to retrieve all details.
looking for a way to recycle my client id and client secret... any way to do this from my end?
and thus we got the ‘99999’ in the property, but as you can see it;s more like a test

The most recent error looks like an authentication error: `The API key provided is invalid`. I see that the query params has `hapikey=inserted%20the%20key%20myself%20here`—is that the real API key that you’re using or did you replace that before posting here?
